I am on level %n! Save mankind from mutants!
It's time to rescue the planet from mutants!
Share your achievement with your friends?
All upgrade points and additions you've purchased were recounted and restored. If you lose your upgrade points or additions, send a message to the technical support team.
The game is running too slowly on your IP. You've automatically quit the arena.
You have a low server connection speed due to the speed Internet of your Internet connection or your distance from the server. You've automatically quit the arena.
Select Arena mode to start playing! And remember to buy equipment, weapons and bonuses. You won't survive without them!
If you want to play this character, click on Buy.
You can install up to five implants. If you want more space, select one implant and click on Return to remove the implant and receive upgrade points back.
You can install up to five upgrades. If you want more space, select one implant and click on Return to remove the implant and receive upgrade points back.
You can't purchase that kind of armory upgrade again.
You can't install more equipment than you have now. If you want to free up room, click on the installed equipment. This removes the equipment.
You can't purchase that kind of equipment upgrade again.
A friend of yours joined your camp!
The number of people in your camp is on the rise and you receive +1,000 equipment points and +1 improvement point!
There is no more available room in your camp. If you want to free up room, click on one of your added friends. The number of places in the camp depends on your level.
This player has already joined your camp!
You can add people with an experience level close to yours or one level higher than yours.
You can't add yourself to your camp!
Complete every mission and carry out every bonus task to increase your level as much as possible and acquire the most bonuses.
Play in different modes, get a rating for each battle and your level will increase. You receive bonuses as a reward.
Earn every upgrade to maximize the level of your character and weapons.
You've earned the full golden award - 100 experience points! And you get +1 upgrade point.
The anti-cheating system or the game's administrators have banned you from playing. If this was due to an error, contact our technical support team.
The Arena becomes available when you reach level 2. Play the Survival and Mission modes first.
You can't play anymore. You can wait 30 minutes until the next game or learn more about purchasing an arena.
The Flash player blocks connections of non-active windows. Don't leave the game window and don't click outside the window while you're in a line!
Searching for players! Don't leave the game window!
You're in a line! Don't leave the game window!
Server at capacity. Please try again in 10 minutes.
Server connection too slow or lost.
This game requires access to your list of friends. Allow access?
Install this on your page to start playing!
If your purchase is lost, click on Restore.

The anti-cheating system detected that you were trying to jailbreak the game. If you do this again, you will be banned from the server. You also will permanently lose all of your purchases and achievements.
If this was due a game error, please contact the technical support team.
The weapon is purchased before a battle. If your character has this kind of weapon, it will be replaced with a new one, but your bullets will remain the same.
The bonuses are spent if you use them in battle. To do so, click their icon during the game.
You won by deception. The stats won't be added to your profile.

The Nuclear Physicist got his name from his father, who developed nuclear weapons for the government. He was a young boy when the infection appeared, and he and his father valiantly defended their house against hordes of mutants. The Nuclear Physicist can still remember the terror of watching a mutant worm that had smashed its way through their cellar walls swallow his father whole. Searching through his fathers things, he found notes about how to upgrade any weapon. But his most important find was a heavy metal box containing his father's best invention - a Plasma Cannon. The Nuclear Physicist swore to avenge his father, so he seeks out infected areas looking for the worm and incinerating thousands of mutants with his cannon.

Once a minute, the Nuclear Physicist can unleash a plasma ball. The ball hovers in front, freezing every enemy and inflicting damage of 1 life point. After 4 seconds, the ball blows up, inflicting damage of 1 life point on all enemies within the blast radius.

The only thing that remained in the wake of the infection was a number of small military detachments. The soldiers of these stalwart units forged fortresses out of the ruined cities and defended themselves against the mutants. While on a scouting mission, one of the detachments encountered a swarm of bugs. When the sergeant saw the mutants killing his friends, he went mad and began spraying the battlefield with gunfire. The hail of bullets killed not only the bugs, but also his friends. When a rescue craft arrived, he refused to leave his bazooka behind. Since that day, he's been called Destroyer. People say he appears at infected zones from time to time to kill mutants with his bazooka.
Once a minute, the Destroyer can use guided missile launchers. All enemies on the screen and the Destroyer get damage of 6 life points.

The gangs began to quickly spread in the ruined, disease-infested world. To protect their camps, the survivors hired people experienced in making trips to infected territory. The survivors called them "hirelings". The hirelings formed teams from experienced mountain men and volunteers with combat skills. Sometimes, small hireling teams ventured deep into infected territory to procure food, spare parts and medicines. The hirelings are used to operating in groups. Stragglers have almost no chance of surviving alone...
Once a minute, the Hireling can use his battle skills, shooting from two of the same weapon at the same time for 4 seconds.

Survivors sometimes needed help military men or hirelings couldn't provide. Those in power could ask killers for help. A typical task for a killer would involve sneaking into a camp and neutralizing a victim. To fool a victim, she parades around like a street walker, and when she's attracted her victim, she ends his life. After a kill, she seeks out shelter within the deepest infected areas.
Once a minute, the Killer can cause blood-chilling horror among his victims. All enemies on the screen are frozen and receive damage of 1 life point.

When the infection started, the Hunter refused to evacuate and instead stayed behind and protected his home. Through that experience, the Hunter learned how to survive in infected area by using food, bullets and his powers sparingly. The only things the Hunter trusts are his weapons. Still, when the military asked him to protect the area around his house, he agreed he would as long as they provided him with food. In return, the officers promised to send a rescue helicopter to get him if things got out of hand.
Once a minute, the Hunter can use 3 plasma traps that are triggered either after 5 seconds or when the enemy approaches. The blast freezes the enemies and inflicts damage of 1 life point.

The story of the Half-Mutant began with a betrayal. When a rescue helicopter dropped in to take his team out of a battle zone, there wasn't enough room for him on the chopper, so his friends threw him out. He used every last bullet in his arsenal to fight back the mutant hordes, but eventually had to run. Before falling over from exhaustion, he removed his anti-radiation suit and tore off his gas mask. "This is the end," he said. Wounded and nearly depleted, he ran into an abandoned hangar, where he found a firegun. Revived, he ran back outside and sprayed the mutants with fire, choking as the smoke from their burning flesh hit his throat. "That's the smell of me surviving," he said, gritting his teeth. When his weapon ran out of fuel, he tossed it aside and started tearing at the mutants with his teeth and nails. He eventually overcame his enemies, and a nearby group of survivors saw him bite off the head of the last mutant. They thought he was infected and had already trained their guns on him when he cried out, "Don't shoot! I'm a survivor!" Since that day, he's been trying to find out why he mutated and looking for the people who betrayed him.

Once every 60 seconds, the Half-mutant transforms into a monster for seven seconds. While in this state, he can move and attack very quickly. The transformation also restores his life points and increases his survival or task rating.

People say the Fanatic went mad even before he acquired his abilities. Before the infection, he was studying the effects of plasma on human genes in an effort to create a superman. He was so obsessed with his experiments, he used himself as a subject in one. Unfortunately, there was an accident, and an explosion of unstable plasma destroyed his lab. No one knows how he survived or where he got his Superpower to control electricity. Some people heard him say he's looking for an energy source in the infected areas as well as artifacts created by mutations. Regardless, people give him a lot of space because they think he's a freak.
Once every 60 seconds, the Fanatic becomes an electric storm. For five seconds, he jumps around like lightning and damages nearby enemies.

During the first few days of the infection, the military tried to stop it from spreading using means that were less than human, including dropping nuclear bombs on major population centers. This killed a lot of mutants, but wiped out large numbers of perfectly healthy humans, too. A nuclear explosion killed the beloved girlfriend of the Telepathist and doused him with radiation. When he regained consciousness under the rubble of a demolished building, he discovered he was alone. Enraged, he swore to kill everyone involved in the death of his girlfriend. As time passed, he discovered the radiation had given him supernormal abilities, including pyrokinesis, psychokinesis and heightened senses. A thirst for revenge compels the Telepathist to turn his abilities against any and all survivors.
Once every 30 seconds the Telepathist can create a fireball. The fireball blast inflicts damage of 4 life points.

In every camp of survivors, there was one trusted person to whom every looked for guidance. Until her mutation, the Witch was one such leader. One day, she decided to clean out a particular lair to end the frequent attacks by the bugs living there. Several people disagreed with her plan and refused to risk their lives to carry it out. Undeterred, and with a smaller than anticipated force behind her, she attacked the lair. She was injured during the fight, but no one would come to her rescue. Worse, those who came with her left her in the lair and told everyone at camp she'd died. When the Witch opened her eyes, she could barely breathe and was covered with a slimy substance. She thought she would die there, but the bugs left her alone, and she was able to escape. Mystified, it took her a few moments to realize her DNA has been mixed with the DNA of a mutant. She's left with an unbearable hunger and a desire to sink her teeth into the flesh of her betrayers and rip it from their bones. She sneaks into camps, killing everyone she encounters.
Curing: Three life points per second
Once every 30 seconds the Witch casts a bug swarm. You can blast the bugs to kill them. Each bug inflicts damage of 2 life points; 12 bugs in total.

A secret government military detachment formed before the infection put up the best fight against the mutants. Its primary goal was protecting the government through special ops at the epicenter of the infection. As the infection spread across the world, the Cyborg was the only one in the detachment to survive. Tragically, he hopes to use his abilities to find and rescue others from his former detachment.
Once every 15 seconds the Cyborg hits the ground with his metal arm, creating around him a gravitational wave that pushes all enemies away from the Cyborg and inflicting damage of 1 life point.

The infection jumped quickly from city to city, taking over everyone with whom it came in contact. As countless people succumbed to the horror, the survivors speculated about its origin. Some said the infection was the result of a scientific experiment gone wrong. Others said it was nature's response to the destructive behavior of human beings. After the infection appeared, the survivors formed the first encampments and set about the task of determining the source of the infection in the hopes of bringing the plague to an end.

The survivors in a southern camp decided to travel north to find the source of the infection. They gathered together their best gunmen in an attempt to put together a team that would be able to survive in an infected zone. Their path would take them through an abandoned farm that contained a number of wind turbines.

Leaving the decimated farm still crawling with zombies, the heroes proceeded through the Wasteland, a desert region populated by mutants. In time, the detachment came to an enormous junkyard. A local resident reported seeing aggressive animal-like mutants with no skin among the mountainous piles of junk. "Thick veins covered their muscles and pulsated with fury," the man told them.

The battle lasted several hours. Just as the group was starting to gain some ground, something huge rushed toward them through the piles of metal, tossing twisted cars here and there. Then they heard shrill howl.

After the group had killed the Red Brainwinch, they saw an entrance to a strange lair. They reasoned that the source of the infection might lie within it, so they went inside. As they descended lower and lower into the pit, they noticed more and more mutant eggs on the walls.
The insects attacked them again and again in an effort to kill them and protect their eggs. Among the hundreds of enemies they encountered, they saw one species with a super-strong protective shell.
As they made their way through the lair, the heroes found a deep crack in the wall. When they approached it, hundreds of red bugs - the most dangerous mutant insect - appeared.

The heroes didn't find anything of interest in the lair, but did manage to pull themselves out of the jaws of the bugs. Then they entered an abandoned factory. Among the rusty barrels and fallen beams, something horrifying was about to make itself known...

While standing over the corpses of two creatures, the heroes decided to search the factory for clues to the source of the infection. Why leave any stone unturned, they reasoned, including a major industrial complex?

They found nothing of interest in the abandoned factory other than broken chemical equipment and dozens of double-legs, horned creatures filled with acid. These bugs were especially tough to defeat because they spewed acid if they were enraged or about to die.

The expedition walked an entire day on a broken highway covered with abandoned cars to reach another city. As night fell, they found themselves approaching the town. Walking deep into its ruins, they spotted a huge pack of red double-legs.

The city was full of mutants. The group of heroes had to get to the other side of the city and find the survivors who had promised to show them a military laboratory, the place from which the infection might have come.

Having survived the fight with the tentackled mutants, the heroes continued to make their way to the abandoned laboratory. The further they went into the infected city, the more insect-covered zombies they met. In a revolting example of mutant symbiosis, the zombies were tearing off the insects and throwing them at the survivors.

The survivors found the exit to the abandoned military laboratory and went down to the first underground level. They found upturned tables, barrels filled with chemicals and smashed blue incubators. Nobody knew what the scientists were growing there, as the volunteers hadn't found any documentation.

Mutation - that's what the scientists in the laboratory were studying. They inadvertently created monsters while performing experiments on the genes of animals. This mutation was the beginning of the infection and the end of the human race.

In the laboratory, the survivors found a massive hole in the floor that led to the lair of the insects. Believing it to be the epicenter of the infection, the heroes descended into the stench-filled abyss.

The heroes killed the womb in the lair and then discovered they were trapped by the insects, which were growing in number! Someone saw a pinpoint of light at the far end of a cave, and the heroes ran toward it as they fired their weapons over their shoulders. On the surface, they found themselves at the foot of a mountain near a demolished city. Although they were stunned, the sound of the advancing mutant horde prompted them to continue their escape.

As soon as the survivors were safe, they decided to return to camp and tell everyone about the source of the infection. In the burnt forest, they found a frozen lake. Fire had consumed everything around the lake, but the water was frozen because of the cold temperatures near the mountains.

The surface of the lake was solid enough to support the heroes. Unfortunately, it also held up under the weight of the mutant hordes, who were hungry for human flesh. The relentless beasts attacked again and again, giving the group no rest or hope of rescue.

After a fight with the mutants called Screamers, the heroes found themselves in the forest again but on the other side of the lake. They saw a desert in the distance and decided to head in that direction, as the map suggested they would find another city. Among the burnt trees, they saw what most of them thought were huge stones. Some of the heroes thought they saw the stones shaking and believed they heard snarling.

Scorched air burned the throats of the heroes as they approached the desert wasteland. This has once been a place of verdant fields and thriving villages, but the government had detonated nuclear bombs over the region in a desperate attempt to prevent the mutation from spreading.

The desert seemed endless. Many of the heroes died, while the others lost their will to survive. In the distance, they saw the silhouette of a city destroyed by a nuclear bomb. The mutants seemed to be without number; no matter how many the survivors killed, even more appeared out of nowhere, stronger and more disgusting than the others.

Long shadows wrapped themselves around ravaged buildings like the claws of a monster. As the heroes made their way through the rubble, they looked for food, weapons, ammunition, and survivors. On every street, they saw fresh blood on the carcasses of ruined cars and piles of uprooted asphalt. Something unthinkable was living in the city, but the only way out was to walk straight through.

The heroes had barely escaped death in the city when they looked toward the horizon and saw countless mutants pouring across the wasteland. Perhaps they had heard the gunfire, and were hungry for meat...
Do not lose more than half of your life points
Kill every boss within one minute
Get an accuracy rating of 70% or more
Get an accuracy rating of 85% or more
Start shooting from the first minute and get an accuracy rating of 85% or more

In this mode, 4 random players with similar levels are put in a closed arena. The winner scores the highest rating by fighting with other players. Rating points are awarded for damage and kills made in this mode. When preparing for battle, don't forget to purchase all required equipment in the game menu.

In Hunt mode, you and one more player have to hold out as long as possible against hordes of mutants. If one of the players dies, the player is restored in 20 seconds. If both players die, the battle is over. The complexity and number of monsters in this mode depend on the total level of the players. When preparing for the hunt, don't forget to purchase all required equipment in the game menu.
In Training mode, you can invite your friends to practice the network game or fight.
You wandered in the abandoned zone for several days and found it at last! A super strong metal walkman is badly needed in the infected world!
In a rusty car, you found a working radiator made out of nano-particles.
It took a lot of work, but you finally got the battery off the horn of the enraged double-leg.
There's nothing more wonderful than finding a box of ammunition and food.
Your friend found a hair dryer and an electric toothbrush in the heap of metal. The quality of your life improves.
You found a huge armory and several fireworks in the cellar of a demolished house.
Inside one worm, you found a weapon, a pan and several knifes. Did the worm swallow them?
In a lair of insane mutant bugs, you and your friends found the most precious artifact of all - the last bottle of shampoo!
In an abandoned area, you met a stranger and exchanged several comic books and magazines for food.
In a demolished house, you found shady artifacts. Perhaps somebody will be able to use them.
In the fragments of a plane that crashed many years ago, you found an artificial limb!
You found what might be the last working PlayStation in the world!
During your last trip to the abandoned area, you found the perfect transport for your camp - a rusty bicycle.
In the center of a crater left by a suicide bomber, you found a bag with equipment.
Tip: Invite your friends to the camp to increase parameters and bonuses.
Tip: Turn off graphics smoothing to increase efficiency.
Tip: Play the game every day to receive a daily bonus. The more friends you invite, the more bonus you'll get.
Tip: Play the game every day to receive a higher daily bonus.
Tip: Your upgrades are based on the awards you earn. Try to earn awards in every mode.
Tip: Arena is a team game mode. You need to buy weapons and bonuses to survive!
Tip: In the group, you can ask questions and get tips and the latest upgrades.
Tip: Visit additions that open up new game possibilities and characters.
Tip: To play Arena mode without any restrictions, pay for one month of game time! It's more profitable!
Tip: Read the Help page, accessible in the upper part of the screen, for more tips.
Tip: To upgrade your character and weapon, visit the Upgrade menu.
Tip: These characters have special skills. To activate the skill, use Superpower button.
Tip: You can ask every friend for help once a day. Press Shift+F to see which of your friends are playing the game.
Survive in the infected area to earn awards. Complete special tasks to earn awards and bonuses.
Play various missions to maximize your rating. Complete bonus tasks to get upgrade points.
Fight against other players or survive a mutant hunt with your friends.
Look at all your achievements in the game and compare them with the results of other players.
Purchase the best weapon and additional bonuses!
Establish a camp with your friends to better protect yourselves!
Find artifacts and get bonuses! Search for at least five consecutive days to increase the value of the bonus. The bonus depends on the number of your friends playing the game.
Die in an infected area and become one of the walking dead.
Survive after returning from infection mode.
Don't miss any bonuses (at least 10). Survive and kill every boss (Survival).
Don't use any powerful weapons, abilities or equipment. Survive and kill every boss (Survival).
Don't use more than one medical kit. Survive and kill every boss (Survival).
Survive and kill every boss with an accuracy rating of more than 95% (Survival).
Kill every boss in less than one minute and survive. (Survival)
Survive without killing the first boss. (Survival)
A thousand mutants will die trying to break your armor!
Kill 1,000 mutants using blast and freezing bonuses.
Survive for each of the two main characters in Survival mode.
Avoid at least five bugs. Survive and kill every boss (Survival).
Your accuracy rating is less than 50%! Be careful, and don't kill any survivors (Survival).
While trying to escape a horrible death, you shot yourself!
Survive with one gun and no abilities or equipment. Kill at least first three bosses (Survival).
One thousand mutants die thanks to your intuition. You even didn't see them!
Your health dipped below 10 points but you survived!
Survive without moving! Stand in one place and kill (Survival).
Let the bugs blow up against your armor! At least 5 bugs. Survive and kill all bosses. (Survival)
Kill 100,000 mutants. Even the Womb can't do that!
Let 1000 mutants destroy each other! (Survival, Missions)
Survive and kill every boss with an accuracy rating of more than 70% (Survival).
Survive and kill every boss without using bonuses or equipment. You can use weapons and medical kits (Survival).
Kill any boss with the blast of another mutant (Survival).
Kill every boss in less than 20 seconds and survive. (Survival)
No one injures you for more than 2 minutes. Survive and kill all bosses. (Survival)
Continue pulling the trigger after the first minute and survive with an accuracy rating of 75% (Survival).
Splash the entire battle field with mutant entrails. (Survival)
Don't move the backsight after the first minute and survive (Survival).
Survive not killing any mutants until after you kill the last boss (Survival)
Stay in one place and don't get injured for 1.5 minutes. (Survival)
Earn seven positive awards that can't be accumulated during one battle (Survival).
Play 3 times in Hunt mode with a friend of level 16. Hold out until wave 9. (Hunt)
Collect at least three bonuses in the arena before the battle (Battle).
Kill two players within three seconds (Battle).
Players need to shoot from different sides (left and right) of the arena and survive at least up to the eighth wave (Hunt).
Beginning with the second wave, one player cannot move, the second player cannot shoot but both players survive until the 8th wave (Hunt).
Survive up to the 12th wave of attacks (Hunt).
Survive up to the 10th wave without losing any players (Hunt).
Take turns in shooting for not more than 10 seconds each. Survive up to at least the eighth wave (Hunting).
Get at least one time bonus after the first minute and survive (Survival).
After the first minute, don't let your health points go above 50. Survive and kill every boss (Survival).
Survive eight waves while running together on the edge of the map beginning with the second wave (Hunt).
Survive until the eighth wave while shooting only from the center of the map starting with the second wave (Hunt).
Kill a player who is 8 or more levels higher than you (or at level 50) (Duel)
Don't move and survive until you kill at least 2 players. (Duel)

Blocks bullets and enemies for 30 seconds
Catches enemies and removes the shield for 30 seconds

Does 20 life points of damage to nearby enemies
Use arrows on your keyboard or buttons A-W-S-D to reach the heap of junk on the left.
Press and hold the left mouse button to shoot. Kill this zombie!
Use the mouse scroll or Q and E buttons to change your weapon. Select a machine gun.
Press and hold the left mouse button to shoot the machine gun. Kill this zombie!
To collect bonuses that fall out your enemies, run to them. Grab this weapon bonus.
Use the mouse scroll or Q and E buttons to change your weapon. Select new weapon.
Press and hold the left mouse button to shoot the flame-thrower. Kill 5 zombies!
Press F button to use the super ability and kill all zombies!
The timer below will show for how much time you need to survive! Click ESC to pause the game if needed.
Transferring brains into the battle mode
Ask your friend for help when you're lack of life points!
Survive in the hunting mode cooperating with other players from the Arena.
Fight other players, capture first place, earn all awards.
When you unlock the equipment, it will become available forever.
All bonuses you've purchased are shown in this panel. Click the Double speed bonus or use button 2 on the keyboard.
Survive in Survival mode 10 times while playing in a random battle.
Hold out for 120 minutes in Survival.
Pass Survival 5 times while playing with full equipment.
Survive in Survival mode 5 times while playing in the arena for friends.
Hold out in 10 games of Duel mode for at least 30 seconds without dying.
Collect a total of 50 bonuses in the Duel mode.
Hold out for 1 minute in 5 battles in Duel mode without killing anyone.
In each of the 3 battles, kill at least 2 players while using only 1 equipment bonus per battle. (Duel)
Enemies in a state of shock for 15 seconds
New character: Nuclear Physicist! The incredible power of the electrocannon and the coolest technologies will be in your hands.
No one could have imagined that the infection would produce new hardships! Only some of heroes will be able to escape icebound death!
If there is no remedy from infection, how can we destroy the endless hordes of mutants? Or are we going to become mutants ourselves?

Each survivor camp had its own leader, who was trusted and obeyed by everyone. Before mutation, he was also the leader in one of the camps. As a result of frequent mutant attacks, he decided to mop up the bug hole. But not everyone agreed with this decision; not everyone wanted to risk their life. During the mop-up operation, the leader was wounded by the mutants. None of the survivors helped him. The betrayers left him in the hole and elected a new leader, while telling everyone that he had died... The Witcher opened his eyes in the dark, wet bug hole. It was difficult to breathe. His entire body was covered with slime. He thought that he would not be able to get out alive. Yet for some reason, the bugs in this hole did not touch him, letting him escape instead. After breaking free, he was horrified: the mutation had mixed his DNA with that of the bugs! Feeling a mutant's unbearable hunger and a desire to devour his betrayers, the Witcher is creeping towards the camp while destroying everyone in his way...
Congratulations, you are one of the top five players for the past week! Enjoy your +30 purchase points!
Congratulations, you are one of the top hundred players for the past week! Enjoy your +5 purchase points!
Invite a friend and win game money.
Hi there, hero! Use the left joystick to reach the pile of trash.
Use the right joystick to shoot where you want. Shoot this zombie.
Weapon pane on the right. Switch to machine gun.
Well done! Kill this zombie with the machine gun.
Collect bonuses falling from the enemies.
Bonus pane on the left. Use the double-speed bonus that you bought.
Super! To destroy all zombies, click the Superpower button.
The timer above indicates the time for which you need to hold out. Happy hunting!
Use the Help from friend button if you have only a few life points left.
Look at your achievements in the game

I gained access to a new character:
I received the next level for an award:
Give us 5 stars and get 30 blue points as a gift!
Click the equipment and hold for two seconds to get the description
Achievements allow unlocking powerful implants. The upper right corner of the screen will display achievements that you can receive in the game.
Various types of weapons will help you during the battle. Do not forget to purchase them prior to each game.
The bonuses will help you during the battle. Do not forget to purchase them prior to each game.
The implants will make your characters more powerful. You can purchase them or earn for achievements.
